Fields.DialogueText: Let's see... if our intel is still good, the Morganas should be...
Come on, you drongos! We don't have all day!
Whoa! Vampire, watch where you're running!
Gah! Go on ahead, you lot! Captain, you scared me.
You almost knocked me overboard.
Sorry, Captain. The crew have been after me to train with them.

Fields.MenuText: You must be pretty good, then.
That's a little egotistical, don't you think?
You could stand to train a little more safely.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what they tell me. And I'm always getting stronger!
Not if it's true. I haven't had a run alone since the start of the tour!
I'll watch myself next time, Captain. I'm used to going through obstacles rather than around them.
Well, hadn't you better catch up with your training buddies?
Oh, let them enjoy their head start, Captain. I'll catch back up to them in no time.
You're going to want to hold off on that. It looks like we've finally caught up to the Morganas.
Beauty! I was just getting warmed up.
@BATTLE
That radio crew of ours is really hitting the coffee hard.
I'm to blame, Captain. After that last run, they're on the hunt for some extra pep.
Won't that just tire them out faster? That's not going to help.
No, I expect it won't.
You're not going to tell them?
I believe in letting people make their own mistakes.

Fields.MenuText: They shouldn't push themselves so hard. They're humans and you're a Belle. You're stronger.
They might surprise you.
That's a little callous.

Fields.DialogueText: They need to find that out for themselves. They might be surprised by how far they get.
I'm counting on it. But they'll never defeat me.
It's not meant to be. Besides, I can fill in for any of them in a pinch. I'm a right corker of a radio operator!
So what's the exercise today?
The usual run around the deck, with a lap's head start for them. And this time, once we're done with endurance, we move to agility.
Meaning?
No drama, Captain. I'll treat them right.
*ALARM*
But I make no such promises for the Morganas!
@BATTLE
You'll wear a hole right through your deck if you keep pacing like that.
It'll survive. Maybe you were right, Captain. About the radio crew, that is.
So why not exercise yourself?
It's just not the same. I'm used to running these routines as a team.

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to go it alone. I'd be happy to join you.
They should shake off the fatigue before long.
So what happens in the meantime?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, would you, Captain? I have to warn you... I don't go easy.
Oh, I don't doubt it. It just feels so much longer going without. Unles... you'd care to join me?
A whole lot of waiting to be put through my paces. Unless you'd care to take their place until they feel up to the task once more?
How can I refuse? It's not every day you get to pit yourself against a ship.
Very well, Captain! Now, for a start, we should get some stretches in...
*ALARM*
We'd better stretch quickly.
Worse than not stretching at all, Captain. Let's make these waves safe for exercise!
No, it's good for them. But they fairly crashed after charging themselves up on coffee. I ordered them to break from our exercises until they could flush that poison.
You run them too hard?
@BATTLE
Looks like your exercises will have to wait, Vampire. We've got Morganas, and they don't look patient.
Let them come. The crew can consider this a warmup!
@BATTLE
All right, on your marks... get set... go!
You really think you can catch up to them with a full lap's head start?
Think, nothing. I believe in marathons, not sprints.
Marathons, eh? Just how long do you have the radio crew running?
Until I'm tired.

Fields.MenuText: Do Belles get tired?
Don't hurt them. We need all the hands we can get.
Is this for them or for you?

Fields.DialogueText: We do eventually. Very eventually.
They're in good hands. Anyone ends up in the infirmary, it's because I carried them there.
Both, of course! They need to toughen up and I need to stay sharp.
Besides, a Belle my age needs to be constantly at the top of her game. My sisters and I were laid down during the Great War, you know.
I guess I don't think of a couple of decades as old.
Oh, you're such a flirt!
Here we come, Vampire! You'd better be ready!
You know, you never did tell me what you meant by "agility."
I thought we'd spar a bit once we finished running.
Do they know that?
Of course! What kind of monster do you take me for?
The sort who tires out her opponents before a fight?
Warmups, Captain! What kind of challenge would it be to fight an unprepared opponent?
Ah... isn't this invigorating?
I'm surprised I'm keeping up with you.
Oh, I'm not even exerting myself yet. I thought we'd start at your pace and build up from there.

Fields.MenuText: I should have guessed you were holding back.
Well, then you'd better keep up with me!
How fast is your fastest?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't feel bad, Captain. There's no sense just blowing you away right out the gate.
Pace yourself! I enjoy our little jogs.
Thirty-four knots.
Now, then, save the earbashing for the warm-down. You'll run out of breath!
That was a test, Captain!
*ALARM*
Oh, rack off, you mongrels! We were just getting started...
@BATTLE
I meant in your... this form.
So did I.
You're the one who started this conversation...
Fancy seeing you in the radio room.
Nothing weakens the immune system quite like running yourself ragged. Literally.
I guess he took it as a challenge.
Everything's a challenge. You've just got to figure the smart ones yourself.
Besides, I can hear Morgana activity much more clearly down here. They're not far off, Captain.
Finally. I was beginning to think that shift would never end.
I guess even Belles get bored now and then.
We're not all workaholics, Captain. I could tell you some stories about my sister Valkyrie, rest her soul...

Fields.MenuText: Wouldn't those all have happened before you awoke?
Well, what are we waiting for?
I wish I could have met her.

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't make the memories any less vivid.
Where to begin? She's got a colourful history, and I haven't really decided which colour is my favorite.
You really do, Captain. She would have been a holy terror as a Belle.
Tell me about her, then.
Hmm... you know, why not make this an exercise of its own? Keep in earshot and I'll tell you all about her.
Well, if it involves keeping pace with you I'll never know, will I?
Oh, it'll be right. I love talking about my family. But if it's worth hearing, it's worth sweating!
Challenge accepted. Get your storytelling voice ready...
Sorry I couldn't join you today. Seems one of the radio crew took a sickie.
Poor mug. I did warn them to work up to my level.
Well, what are we waiting for?
@BATTLE
So when are you going to tell me about your sister, Vampire?
When you earn it! You were close today, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I kept pace with you, didn't I?
I'll get you next time!
I could just look up her service history, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: Most of the way. But you fell behind right at the end. I've got a keen sense for distance.
That's the way! You'll be fit as a Mallee bull in no time.
But what fun would that be? You'd miss all the gossip!
All right, I guess I can throw you a bit of a bone. Did you know I'm the youngest of my sisters?
What's that like?
Cheater.
I can't cheat at a game I made up, can I?
You're certainly winning.
I'll only win when you can keep up with me. Now, come on! I think some Morganas want to play...
You'll find out on our next run, won't you?
@BATTLE
Keep up, Captain! I'm getting impatient here!
You're jogging backwards. While reading a book.
I've got to occupy my time somehow, haven't I? Make me work for this, Captain!
What are you reading, anyway?
Bit of mythology. Borrowed an Iliad off of Cousin Achilles.
She must be a fan of that one.
Oh, God, don't ever get her started on it. She's not much of a reader... unless her namesake is the star of the show, of course.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised she let it out of her sight.
Well, we've all got our fixations.
Is it good?

Fields.DialogueText: I swapped her a copy of Troilus and Cressida. Figjam like her probably wouldn't appreciate parody, but that's her malfunction.
True, but not everyone's walking around with secondhand celebrity.
Bit slow, if we're being honest. I'm more of an Odyssey girl.
I would have thought you were more of a Dracula type.
Really? Whatever for?
Because... you know... you're pale and you've got the whole bat... thing?
Doesn't sound so witty when you have to explain it, does it?
No, but you do slow down when you're perturbed.
What the-
And that's the last lap. Looks like I kept pace.
... Within cooee, Captain. You win this round. Now then...
*ALARM*
Well, would you look at the time? It's bang on Morgana o'clock.
@BATTLE
Grr... Where are they?
Nobody to exercise with. No Morganas to fight. And I've read everything aboard me twice.
Nothing to do but talk about your family, eh?
I'm tempted to only tell you Valkyrie's favourite food, for the way you rorted that win away from me.

Fields.MenuText: She had a favourite food?
Fair's fair.
All I wanted was to know about your family.

Fields.DialogueText: Lutefisk. Any other questions?
You're one to talk. All right, ask away.
... Yes, I recognize that.
It's... It's not important. Don't worry about it.
Oh, come now. You cheated. Capitalize on it.
All right, then. So how is it that you remember your sisters from before you awakened?
If you must know-
@BATTLE
Bored?
*ALARM*
Looks like cheaters never prosper.
But they can win battles fairly handily. Your time to shine.
It has been a while. I've been meaning to give this to you, by the way.
The Odyssey! Where did you find this?
Picked it up in port. You'd finished the Iliad. I thought you might want to pick up where you left off.
I appreciate it, Captain. There's something truly stirring about Odysseus returning to his family after twenty years.
I swear I'm not going to distract you with this one.
Ah, thank you... but I've been meaning to talk to you about that as well. I wanted to apologise. I've been having the pettiest blue with you lately.
Well, I did cheat on our training.
And I let myself get cross over something that... well. My family are important to me. But they wouldn't treat their captains this way over simple curiosity.

Fields.MenuText: Did you talk to them about this?
You're talking about Valkyrie and Valhalla? The ones that...
Think nothing of it. It was my fault.

Fields.DialogueText: I actually haven't talked to Valentine and Valorous in quite some time. Not since I was recommissioned in '38. But I know their hearts.
They didn't live to see this war, Captain, but I know how they'd fight it.
Both of these things can be true, but I can only speak for myself. I know you're willing to speak for yourself.
And I know how seriously you take your training. I'll take it more seriously too from now on.
It's going to have to be a run to the bridge, Vampire. I don't need binoculars to see those Morganas.
Right, then. I'll be sure to let you know how the Odyssey's coming.
@BATTLE
Do you have a run in you, Captain?
Well, no worries, eh? Come on, let's go for a run.
One hundred ninety-eight... One hundred ninety-nine...
Vampire, I wonder if- gah!
Or a vampire.
@BATTLE
Whoa! I've never seen a flip like that.
When you're used to hanging upside down, you get curious about the dismount.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think you could teach me?
How long did it take you to master that?
Do you even need to exercise?

Fields.DialogueText: Mmm... perhaps. I'd have to get my hands on heaps of pillows. I hear Algérie's a great one for those. Might write to her.
Practice, like anything. Being a Belle helps, of course.
Technically, no. Some Belles seem to do without... though I've heard it dings their cruising speed a bit.
But that was nothing. Valkyrie could have jumped from stem to stern without touching the deck!
It's different with Belles, Captain. We might not have walked and talked as you humans do, but sisters just know things about each other.
Like what?
That's a story for another race! Though I can tell you she looked every bit of her namesake.
Hmm? Oh, g'day, Captain. You look like you've seen a ghost.
Well, obviously.
It's just, the way you were upside down-
Core exercises. Never know where you might have to hang from for a clear shot!
And speaking of clear shots... looks like I'm quids in today!
Ah, nothing like some trick shots to fluster the witches. Now then... hah!
If she'd awakened.
Straight out of the Eddas, eh?
Oh, you do know Norse mythology! Well, let me tell you, those paintings of valkyries almost get her right...
Let's see... him. Her. Definiteley him.
You might say that. Word's spreading about that spar I had.
I watched a little bit of that. You took them on one after the other like it was nothing.
I think they learned a lot, Captain. But I need to challenge myself too.
You're pretty much invincible one on one. Maybe if they fought you all at once they'd give you a run for your money.
Bloody oath.
... I was just joking, you know.
I never joke about training.

Fields.MenuText: Don't hurt them.
You don't have a very big complement, you know. Don't put too many of us out of action.
How does this help fight the Morganas?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I won't. But they'll certainly feel it.
I'm factoring that into my decisions. It pays to know exactly who's who and what they do.
They've been collecting humans. Best be ready for anything.
Right, I've made my choices. I'll let them know presently.
When next we make port, I think. It won't do to fight amongst ourselves with Morganas bearing down on us.
Speaking of...
@BATTLE
Picking victims?
When's the big showdown?
Lovely breeze, isn't it?
Not my bowl of rice. Brr...
It's not that cold out.
No, but I remember the waters of the Mediterranean. Once you get used to the warmth, you're all the more sensitive to its absence.
Never thought I'd meet a British ship that didn't like the cold.
Once upon a time, Captain. But I'm a dinkum Aussie now. Still...
Still?
Well, I remember promising my sisters that we'd all meet again. Back home, and damn the chill.
Once this was over?
Even before we were split up. When we were all... elsewhere.

Fields.MenuText: Elsewhere?
Where would you have met?
It sounds like talking to each other in your sleep.

Fields.DialogueText: A lot of the other Belles use "sleeping," but for me that's never really covered it.
Somewhere that one of us came from. Birkenhead and Dumbarton each got two votes. I held out for my beloved Isle of Wight, of course. Still do.
Our seaplanes and motorboats do it too, Captain. You might say we Belles were just lucky, awakening like we did.
Valkyrie and Valhalla can't make it now, of course.
So am I. It's a three-way deadlock now for where to have the reunion.
If that's how you choose to look at it.
I'm the youngest sibling, Captain. I'm allowed.
I'm sorry.
*ALARM*
Ah! This ought to warm us up.
@BATTLE
I think I'm getting cabin fever from this patrol.
Really? I could be out at sea forever!
Well, not forever.
Oh, you know what I mean.
I'm seriously considering watching that fight. How many sailors were you planning on taking on again?
Four. Got to walk before you run, right?
You're a fast walker, Vampire.
@BATTLE
Right, then. I think it's safe for a little controlled violence. Will you do the honours and referee?
Last one in the ring wins. No face shots.
You heard the captain! Come at me!

Fields.MenuText: I saw that, Lieutenant! No face shots!
Go easy on them, Vampire.
Show no mercy, Vampire!

Fields.DialogueText: Reflex, Captain!
Too late!
Easy, Captain! This isn't a blood sport!
Haah... haah... That actually made me sweat!
That looked like a tough one.
Too right! How else do we catch up to these Morganas?
Oh, this is nothing. Valhalla would have taken on eight and asked for more...
Really? She would have been that strong?
The hall of heroes herself! We Belles live up to our names, Captain.
Should I wear a neck brace to bed?
Oh, ha ha. Your neck's perfectly safe from me, Captain.
Good on you, Captain! You haven't once fallen behind.
You're... certainly making me work for it...
Mind over matter, Captain! Let me help. Ahem... Who was the witch that turned Odysseus's men into pigs?
Be serious, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Circe.
Morgan le Fay.
Lilith.

Fields.DialogueText: Got it in one!
I understand why you'd have her on the brain, but the answer is no.
We're not going quite that far back, Captain.
And... done! See how easy that was?
I guess all I needed was a little distraction.
Someone who enjoyed pork.
I should quiz you more often, Captain! You'd be running at thirty-four knots before you knew it.
Ooh! What's a kelpie?
Some kind of Scottish water spirit?
You're not wrong, Captain! But I was thinking of the Australian sheepdog.
Well, that's hardly fair. How am I supposed to know how you think?
You'll get there, Captain. I used to think Valhalla could read my mind some days... we were that close.
Would it have helped in battle?
Well, we couldn't have assumed direct control the way awakened Belles can. But once in a while, if a gun held up to extended fire, or an impossible shot found its mark...
You could nudge your thumb onto the scale.
Sometimes without even realizing that's what we were doing. We'd just smooth out the occasional wrinkle.
*ALARM*
Got a thumb free?
Two whole fists cocked and ready, Captain!
@BATTLE
Ever get up from a long sit and roll your shoulders to work out a kink you hadn't realised was there? Like that.
Did you abuse one of the radiomen again?
It's his own fault, Captain. He saw the fight and insisted we square up one on one. Poor dill fancied himself my equal.
That explains the screaming the other day.
"I want you to hit me as hard as you can." That's what he said.
Did you?
Knowing full well that it falls to me to clean up after them. It's for the best, anyway. He's been slacking at this broken-down station. Damn thing just won't...

Fields.MenuText: Here, hand it over. Let me see if there's anything I can do.
I don't have that much experience with technology, but I can give you a hand if there's anything you need me to do.
Make sure you keep it far away from me, then. If I start playing around with it, it'll break for sure!

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, but it's fine. The sorry state it's fallen into demands a personal touch.
It doesn't look like there's anything I need help with right now, but I'll let you know if there is.
When I'm done here, I'm giving everyone a mandatory course in radio maintenance.
Hey, listen! I think it's working!
Bloody hope so. I didn't come all this way just to fall apart... Wait. Captain, do you hear that?
That sounds like whispering- no, screaming...
Morganas. Get to the bridge and forget you ever heard any of it.
@BATTLE
No, and the way you know that is that he's still alive. I tapped him just hard enough to make a point.
Guess you have to let people make their own mistakes.
You're getting an earlier start than usual.
Couldn't sleep, Captain.
You don't sleep.
Figure of speech. I was going to go mad if I stayed in my quarters any longer.

Fields.MenuText: I'll join you in a run.
This about the Morganas?
Do you need to be alone right now?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd like that, Captain. Getting out into the open air was only half the solution.
Everything's about the Morganas.
No, Captain, I need to talk to someone other than myself.
How would you say we did in that last battle?
We won, didn't we?
I read the after action report. Those Morganas were almost on top of us. On open waters.
They've got a nasty habit of surprising us. It's happened before.
I didn't hear them, Captain! Not just because the radio was buggered. It was like my senses were...
You got distracted. It happens to all of us.
Maybe. Maybe it's nothing. I've been listening double hard today.
Catch anything?
... That way.
@BATTLE
Phew... I don't think I could run another-
Again.
Pardon?
Keep up, Captain. You wanted to hear about my family, didn't you?

Fields.MenuText: We've got all the time in the world for that.
I guess I can force another lap or two out of me.
Is something wrong with them?

Fields.DialogueText: No, Captain, we really don't.
Or three or four. I haven't slowed down since we started. Neither should you.
Not them, Captain. Me.
All right, what's the-
I can't hear them.
Can't hear who?
Valkyrie. Valhalla. I haven't since I awoke.
Well, they were scrapped, weren't they?
Even so, Captain... if I close my eyes and listen very hard, I can recall how they fought. Who they were... what they could have become.
@BATTLE
But I'm losing them, Captain. I'm losing track of them them just as I lost track of the Morganas the other day in the radio room.
If they're lost, they can be found again. Right?
I don't know, Captain. But if my memory's carking it, I'll be damned if anything else does.
*ALARM*
Looks like we've got-
Morganas. At least I can still hear them.
Watch your step, Captain.
Long enough.
Core exercises?
@BATTLE
I was, Captain. Just on my own this time.
The crew are getting worried.
I'll be back training them before too long. I need to run at my own pace for a while. If I slow down... well, I can't slow down.

Fields.MenuText: Everyone does eventually.
When you do, we'll be here.
And the crew can?

Fields.DialogueText: Not everyone's a ship.
I hope so, Captain. I really do. There will be better ships.
You can train away laziness. You can't train away obsolescence.
Is that what you're worried about?
It's what I see coming. You could say it runs in the family.
How long have you been hanging there?
... And I admit it helps me think.
Have you got some more trick shots up your sleeve?
*ALARM*
If there's a limit, I haven't found it.
You weren't training today.
Brr...
I thought you didn't like the cold.
I don't like a lot of things. It doesn't mean I can't learn to live with them.

Fields.MenuText: At least let me bring you some tea.
Need an extra blanket?
Need a bonfire?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know what we're fighting for if not that.
If you could fetch me one of those fire blankets, that would be downright spiffy. Maybe set me on fire first.
I know a certain radioman whose grog ration would make an excellent starter.
Okay, what's the first thing I should know?
I'm sorry for casting a pall, Captain.
Don't be. I can't imagine what it's like to be purpose-built.
It's double-edged, Captain. It's kind of neat to be keenly aware of every part of yourself. I can turn on a dime or squeeze off a round unassisted...
Not to mention letting our engineers know exactly what to fix.
Being a Belle has its perks. But if you've ever felt aches and pains... well, you don't have people constantly quantifying them. Deciding whether a few degrees off your elevation range-
-Means upgrade or scrap.
Exactly. And meanwhile the Morganas just upgrade themselves again and again.
*ALARM*
I don't really have an answer for you.
@BATTLE
I wasn't really expecting one. Especially not right before a battle. But thank you for listening.
We live in a different world than Valhalla and Valkyrie did. We know our ships are people now. And we fight like hell for our people.
That we do, Captain. I think... I can handle a little cold for now.
One of these days I'm going to hang a wreath of garlic in that spot you like.
Oh, would you, Captain? It's my favourite.
... Really?
Especially slow-roasted. Mmm...
As long as you're comfortable hanging there, I suppose.
One of these days you should join me. Sometimes a change of perspective helps put things in... well, in perspective.
I'll pass, but I appreciate the offer.
Our talk about my sisters got some wheels turning, Captain. I thought I'd find some clarity in my favourite story.

Fields.MenuText: The one about Baldr's death?
The one about Thor in a dress?
The one about Ragnarok?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, crikey, no. Though I did quite like the part about him being invincible.
It's not my favourite, but it's a contender!
That's a really stirring tale, but I've never much been one for endings.
To tell you the truth, Odin was always my favourite of the gods. The way he gave up an eye for wisdom... I've always respected that kind of sacrifice.
When you know how the world's going to end, you don't need depth perception.
*ALARM*
So. Norse mythology today?
I don't imagine it did much for his depth perception.
Not even against Morganas?
... It helps. I think I can hit that one from here...
@BATTLE
Join me in a bottle of wine later, Captain?
Of course, Vampire. Celebrating our impending victory?
That too.
@BATTLE
All right, see that target?
What's that a picture of? ... Sorry, I mean who?
That there is the HMS Caledonia. And I hate her with all my heart.

Fields.MenuText: She looks beautiful.
What did she do to you?
I didn't realize warships felt this way about ocean liners.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! That must be the wine talking.
Nothing. It's really more what she represents.
Oh, how I wish it was just prejudice.
She's what Valkyrie died for. She and a heap of destroyers who were just doing their jobs. Traded for a war prize that wasn't worth a zack so the Navy could have a new training ship.
That's a fairly uneven trade.
You're a crack shot after a couple of glasses.
I don't set the value of scrap. But if I did, one of Valkyrie's propellers would be worth ten of Caledonia! A glorified cruise ship... Gah!
I ought to be, after more than twenty years at this.
And why was Valhalla scrapped?
Who knows? She was barely alive for the thirties. Hmph... to think I used to envy my sisters.
You're the best of them.
No, Captain, I'm not. I wasn't selected to intervene in Russia's civil war like Valkyrie. I was sold to the arse end of the world.
But just you wait. I'll come roaring back to Europe, stronger and better than they could have dreamed. And then...
Revenge?
Hmm? No, Captain, what kind of yobbo do you take me for?
I'll just be too strong to throw away. Too strong for the Morganas to harm anyone in the Empire. And I accomplish that by carrying my sisters' memories with me... even if I can't quite remember them.
That sounds pretty legendary.
I guess I just read the right books.
Looks like Command's sending us around the Philippines for our next patrol.
Hmm. It's no Mediterranean, but it ought to be a nice change of pace.
I'll say. Lovely beaches, mountains off in the distance...
Tuglibong, Bacobaco, the angongoloods...
Come again?
Oh, there's some ripper myths that come from there, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: What's a Tuglibong?
I'll bite. A Bacobaco is...
Right, so... angongoloods?

Fields.DialogueText: A right mean oldie who nagged the sky until it stayed up!
Great stonking turtle that lives in a mountain. We'll be right as long as the Morganas don't wake it.
Gorillas that hug you until you're a tree. I don't understand it, either.
But my favourite myth's got to be about the berbalangs. Spirit cannibals that sneak up on you.
But that's not the worst part! They're always the opposite of where they appear to be, so if you see one you turn around and start blasting!
I see. But what if-
But that's not the worst part! They're loud when they're far away, but the closer they get, the quieter they scream... until all falls silent, when you think you're safe. That's when they-
Boo.
GAH! Captain, don't scare me that way!
Now, just wait a minute. If they're louder the farther away they are, why aren't they screaming us deaf right now?
... Well, it's just a story.
Looks like we've got some real monsters to take care of. At least these ones mostly make sense.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Oh, good heavens.
Nice.
I've met admirals like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Vampire, I'll race you to the bridge!
What? Ooh... there's your head start, Captain. Enjoy it!
I thought about what you told me the other day. You know... about your sisters. About your memories.
Oh, pay it no mind, Captain. It just bothers me.
It'd be strange if it didn't.
I know what you're going to suggest. I've thought about this every day, Captain, believe me. There's no getting back what I've lost from my subconscious. And one day-

Fields.MenuText: -I'll be forgotten too.
-You'll be a museum ship, telling your story to everyone.
-We'll get them back. We'll rebuild them.

Fields.DialogueText: What? Captain, no. We're carving your name into history.
... You know, I've always wanted to meet Old Lady Victory.
Doesn't work that way, Captain. At best you'd get new Belles entirely with vague recollections of who the old Valkyrie and Valhalla were.
Someone had to write all those stories you love reading. They changed in the telling. But they still inspire you, don't they?
@BATTLE
You're in an inspired mood today, Captain. Right wobbly.
Too right. You know, you may be on to something. We Belles are going to be remembered for generations to come!
... When we win, that is.
I'd say you already are. Valkyrie and Valhalla are just as inspiring as any gods or monsters you've told me about. The difference is that they're real.
Well, I'll be stuffed, Captain. You know, these tales do grow in the telling.
It won't be long before people start saying that Valkyrie escorted people to Valhalla.
I don't know about that, Captain. But we're certainly doing our best to bring back the dead.
All right, what's the training session today?
Here we go... you and me against eight of our strongest, Captain!
I'm flattered, but I don't really think I can handle four opponents.
Oh, no, Captain - I'll take seven and you'll take one.
Now that's almost insulting.
Four. I might learn a thing or two from the berbalangs while we're in the Philippine Sea.
I've got a coconut pearl squirreled away specifically for that purpose.

Fields.MenuText: You and me, Vampire. I wouldn't have it any other way.
Just try and keep up with me!

Fields.DialogueText: Now there's a tale I'd like to see grow in the telling.
You'll outgrow that headstart before you know it!
Legends have to start somewhere, don't they? You'll work up to... I'd say three by the end of the tour.
Some kind of protection?
Got it in one, Captain. It'll take more than demons and ghosts to get rid of me.
Now, then... are you ready?
A surprise for after these Morganas, Captain. Don't worry - I think you're more than ready.
@BATTLE
